alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Goochland; Western Hanover; Western Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 12:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Louisa, northeastern Cumberland, Goochland, northwestern Hanover, Powhatan and east central Fluvanna Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1212 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Kents Store to Fife to Tobaccoville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Powhatan, Goochland, Louisa, Mineral, Hadensville, Cartersville, Gum Spring, Oilville, Manakin, Ferncliff, Tobaccoville, Trenholm, Macon, Sabot, Kents Store, Fife, Sunnyside, Bumpass, Montpelier and Ballsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central and north central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Goochland; Western Hanover; Western Louisa
